msItem.title: Funeral Services, with appropriate lessons, etc.
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܚܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܢ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚܐ: ܡܫܪܝܢܢ ܕܢܟܬܘܒ ܟܘܪܣܐ ܕܥ̈ܢܝܕܐ: ܟܠܡܕܡ ܕܡܬܐܡܪ ܥܠ ܟܪܣ̈ܛܝܢܐ

msItem.title: Various anthems,ܥܘ̈ܢܝܬܐ, according to different tones

item.p: The first quire of a vellum manuscript, about 7 1/4 in. by 5 1/4, (Add. 14,525, foll. 1—10). There are from 21 to 25 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: Written in a neat, regular hand of the ixth or xth cent.

item.p: On fol. 2 a there is a note stating that the book belonged by purchase to the deacon Moses bar Ḥafṣ of Rās-'ain

p.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܕܡܘܫܐ ܡܫܡܫܢܐ ܒܪ ܚܦܨ (حَفْص) ܢܖܣܒܖܝܐ (sic) ܡܢ ܪܝܫܥܝܢܐ ܕܩܢܝܗ ܐܝܟ ܕܠܝܘܬܪܢܐ ܕܩܢܘܡܗ ܘܕܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܦܓܥܝܢ ܒܗ. ܟܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܫܐܠ ܠܗ ܒܙܢܐ ܐܝܢܐ ܕܗܘ ܘܟܡܢ ܥܠܝܗ ܏ܘܫ

item.p: On fol. 1 b there is another note, which tells us that this volume was presented by Shabūr bar 'Idūraḳ (?) and his nephew Ḥabīb bar Simeon, of Rās-'ain, to the monastery of S. Mary Deipara, in the time of the abbat Moses of Nisībis . This note was written by one Yeshua' at Ramla in Palestine, A.H. 332 = A.D. 943-4.

p.quote: ܒܫܡܐ ܕܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܡܫܒܚܬܐ ܥܠܬܐ ܕܟ̈ܠܗܝܢ ܛܒ̈ܬܐ ܩܪܒܘ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܫܒܘܪ ܒܪ ܥܝܕܘܪܩ ܘܒܪ ܐܚܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܚܒܝܒ ܒܪ ܫܡܥܘܢ ܕܡܢ ܪܝܫܥܝܢܐ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ ܩܪܒܗ (sic) ܕܝܢ ܠܥܘܡܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܣ ܡܛܠ ܦܘܪܩܢܐ ܕܢܦܫܬܗܘܢ ܘܚܘܣܝܐ ܕܥܢܝܕܝܗܘܢ ܒܝ̈ܘܡܝ ܫܘܒܗܪܐ ܕܝܠܢ ܘܨܒܬܐ ܕܟܠܗ̇ ܥܕܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܡܪܝ ܡܘܫܐ ܪܝܫܕܝܪܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܥܘܡܪܐ. ܟܠ ܕܩܪܐ ܢܨܠܐ ܥܠܝܗܘܢ ܘܥܠ ܚܛܝܐ ܕܐܬܛܝܒܘ (sic) ܝܫܘܥ ܒܨܝܪܐ ܒܫܡܐ ܕܕܝܪܝܐ (sic) ܕܗܘܪܩ ܘܫܐܠ ܨܠܘܬܟܘܢ. ܗ̈ܠܝܢ ܗܘ̈ܝ ܒܪܡܠܐ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ ܒܐܝܪܚ ܐܝܠܘܢ (sic) ܫ̈ܢܬ ܬܠܬܡܐ ܘܬܠܬܝܢ ܘܬܪ̈ܬܝܢ ܕܛܝ̈ܝܐ

item.p: The writing on fol. 1 a is too much effaced to be legible.

msItem.title: Part of the Services for Passion Week, including prayers of Ephraim and Jacob
Services for Wednesday
msItem.note: There is a lacuna after fol. 18.

item.p: Fourteen vellum leaves, about 7 1/4 in. by 5 3/8 (Add. 14,525, fol. 11-24). There are from 21 to 25 lines in each page. There is a lacuna after fol. 18.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the xth or xith cent.

msItem.title: ܥܢܝ̈ܢܐ, or anthems, for the Nativity, the Massacre of the Innocents, and the Epiphany

item.p: Three vellum leaves, about 6 7/8 in. by 5 1/4. There are 23 or 24 lines in each page. These leaves have the appearance of being palimpsest.

handNote.desc: These leaves were written in a fair hand of the xth or xith cent.

msItem.title: Anthems and hymns (ܥܢܝ̈ܢܐ ܘܩ̈ܠܐ) for the festivals of the whole year
Anthems and hymns for the Epiphany
The Commemoration of S. John the Baptist
The Presentation of our Lord in the Temple and the Commemoration of S. Simeon the Aged

item.p: Eighteen vellum leaves, about 7 1/4 in. by 5 3/8 (Add. 14,525, foll. 28—45). There are from 16 to 23 lines in each page. These leaves have the appearance of being palimpsest.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the xth or xith cent.

msItem.title: Canons and anthems for the festivals of the whole year

item.p: Ten vellum leaves, about 7 1/4 in. by 5 3/8 (Add. 14,525, foll. 46—55). There are from 23 to 26 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the xth or xith cent.

msItem.author: Severus
msItem.title: The Benediction of the Chalice, of Severus
msItem.rubric: ܪܫܡ ܟܣܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܣܐܘܪܐ ܦܛܪܐܪܟܐ ܕܐܢܛܝܘܟܐ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ

msItem.author: Cyriacus of Tellā
msItem.title: Prayers, in part alphabetical, ascribed to Cyriacus of Tellā
The Order of the Consecration of Water

item.p: Twenty vellum leaves, about 7 1/8 in. by 5 1/4, several of which are much stained and torn (Add. 14,525, foll. 56—75). There are from 16 to 22 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is neat and regular, of the xth cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
